productionType.cannotEndTurnDueToLackOfProduction: you are not producing enough Rations to feed your city populations and your army. Allocate more farmers in cities, or disband some units.

productionType.unitKilledFromLackOfProduction: left your army because you couldn't afford to pay them
productionType.buildingSoldFromLackOfProduction: sold because you couldn't afford to maintain it
productionType.cannotEndTurnDueToLackOfProduction: you are not producing enough Gold to maintain your buildings or pay your army. Alter your tax rate, use Alchemy to convert Mana into Gold, sell some buildings, or disband some units.

productionType.unitKilledFromLackOfProduction: was unsummoned because you couldn't afford their mana upkeep
productionType.spellSwitchedOffFromLackOfProduction: was switched off because you couldn't afford its upkeep
productionType.cannotEndTurnDueToLackOfProduction: you are not producing enough Mana to maintain your spells or summoned units. Increase the proportion of Magic Power that is being used to generate Mana, use Alchemy to convert Gold into Mana, switch off some overland, city or unit spells, disband some summoned units, or break some hero items on the anvil.

pick.pickHelpText: Life spells focus on healing, protections and inspirational enchantments, and planar travel. Life magic forcefully opposes the forces of death and mildly resists the forces of chaos.
Death spells provide the summoning and controlling of the dead and the forces of darkness. Death magic has powerful enchantments that strike disease and misfortune upon their enemies.
Chaos spells deal primarily with corruption and destruction, calling upon the elemental forces of change.
Nature spells control the raw forces of earth and water, as well as fertility and growth.
Sorcery spells focus on elemental forces of air and illusion. Sorcery also has a number of meta-magic spells that resist and control other wizard's spells.

Allows the wizard to change gold into mana and mana into gold in a 1 to 1 ratio, instead of loosing ½ in the exchange process.
It also gives all units built in cities magic weapons with +1 to hit bonus and the ability to hurt units with Weapon Immunity, the same as if they were built in a city with an Alchemists' Guild.
The Alchemy retort is the only way that Gnolls, Klackons, Lizardmen or Trolls can build units with magic weapons, since these races cannot build Alchemists' Guilds.

Increases the level of all units under the wizard's control by one level.
In addition, Warlord allows your units to achieve Ultra-Elite status which can only be attained by having the Warlord retort or by casting the Life spell Crusade, or the Champion status which can only be attained by having both the Warlord retort and casting the Life spell Crusade.

Allows the wizard to cast spells in combat as if the battle took place at his fortress, which means channeler does not spend any extra mana when casting any spell in combat.
In addition, a channeler only pays one half the normal spell maintenance.

Archmage increases the wizard's skill by +10, and makes it twice as hard to dispel any of his spells.
Also, there is a 50% bonus to all magic power spent on increasing skill.

Artificer reduces the cost of making magical items by 50%.
Artificers also begin the game with the Create Magic Item and Create Artifact spells.
Summoner reduces the casting cost and maintenance of all summoning spells by 25%, and also gives a 25% bonus to research put towards summoning spells.
Sage gives a 25% bonus to research towards all spells.

Wizard begins the game in a city on Myrror instead of Arcanus. The Myrran wizard starts with an unusual race: Beastmen, Dark Elves, Draconians, Dwarves, or Trolls, and will have earlier access to more powerful lairs and nodes containing more powerful treasures.
In addition the wizard's fortress generates 5 additional mana.
Increases the pacifying effects and magic power the wizard obtains from shrines, temples, parthenons, and cathedrals by 50%.
Famous increases the wizard's game by +10, and doubles the chance of a wizard hiring heroes, recruiting mercenaries, and buying magical items.

The power of all dispel magic type spells is doubled.
In addition, arcane spells have a 25% bonus to research and a 25% reduction in casting cost.

Possesses an unnatural presence that dramatically improves his dealings with others.
The charismatic wizard pays half for hiring heroes, mercenaries, and purchasing magical items.
In addition, all diplomatic penalties from negative actions are halved and good diplomatic effects are doubled.

Increases the wizard's chaos spell research by 15%, reduces the casting cost of chaos spells by 15%, makes it twice as hard to dispel the wizard's chaos spells, and doubles the magic power obtained from chaos nodes.

Increases the wizard's nature spell research by 15%, reduces the casting cost of nature spells by 15%, makes it twice as hard to dispel the wizard's nature spells, and doubles the magic power obtained from nature nodes.

Increases the wizard's sorcery spell research by 15%, reduces the casting cost of sorcery spells by 15%, makes it twice as hard to dispel the wizard's sorcery spells, and doubles the magic power obtained from sorcery nodes.
Increases the pacifying effects and magic power the wizard obtains from shrines, temples, parthenons, and cathedrals by 50%.
Increases the mana obtained from magic power by 25%.

Node Mastery doubles the magical power obtained from all nodes.
In addition the wizard is able to freely cast spells inside nodes which would normally have a chance of being dispelled.

race.raceAdvantages: Barbarian populations grow faster than any other races. Barbarian are one of the few races who can build Warships, so have an advantage in naval battles.
race.raceDisadvantages: Barbarians have no particularly interesting or powerful units to build. Barbarians cities are quite limited in the buildings they are able to build.

race.raceAdvantages: All Gnoll units have +2 melee attack compared to other races and can build Wolf Riders, which are the fastest unit on foot in the game (with the exception heroes using speed improving magic items).
race.raceDisadvantages: Gnoll populations grow slowly. Gnolls cannot build Sages' Guilds, so research is severly limited. Also this means they cannot build Alchemists' Guilds and so cannot use Mithril or Adamantium weapons, and can only use magical weapons by having the Alchemy retort.

race.raceAdvantages: Halfling farmers produce 3 rations instead of the usual 2. Their units have 8 figures instead of the usual 6, which gives them additional damage and hit points per unit. They can build Slingers, which are considerably better than regular Bowmen.
race.raceDisadvantages: Halfling cities are quite restricted in the buildings they are able to build.

race.raceAdvantages: High Elves generate ½ magic power per population and are the only race on Arcanus with this ability. They can build Longbowmen, which are considerably better than regular Bowmen.
race.raceDisadvantages: High Elf populations grow very slowly.

race.raceAdvantages: High Men are one of the few races who can build Warships, so have an advantage in naval battles.
race.raceDisadvantages: The only particularly interesting High Men units are Paladins, but these require a number of buildings to be constructed before they can be built.

race.raceAdvantages: All Klackon units have +2 defence compared to other races. Klackon workers produce 3 production each instead of the usual 2.
race.raceDisadvantages: Klackons have no ranged units. Klackon units are more expensive to build compared to other races. Klackon populations grow slowly. Klackons cannot build Sages' Guilds, so research is severly limited. Also this means they cannot build Alchemists' Guilds and so cannot use Mithril or Adamantium weapons, and can only use magical weapons by having the Alchemy retort.

race.raceAdvantages: Lizardmen can swim. Lizardmen populations grow faster than normal, slower only than Barbarians.
race.raceDisadvantages: Lizardmen cannot build Sages' Guilds, so research is severly limited. Also this means they cannot build Alchemists' Guilds and so cannot use Mithril or Adamantium weapons, and can only use magical weapons by having the Alchemy retort.

race.raceAdvantages: Nomads receive additional gold in the form of an inter-city trade bonus.
race.raceDisadvantages: Nomads have no particularly interesting or powerful units to build. Nomad populations grow slowly.

race.raceAdvantages: Orcs are the only race to be able to construct every type of building. Orcs are one of the few races who can build Warships, so have an advantage in naval battles.
race.raceDisadvantages: Orcs have no interesting or powerful units to build.

race.raceAdvantages: All Beastmen units have +1 melee attack compared to other races and they can build Minotaurs, which are powerful close combat units.
race.raceDisadvantages: Beastmen units are more expensive to build compared to other races.

race.raceAdvantages: All Dark Elf units have a magical ranged attack, even Spearmen. Dark Elves generate 1 magic power per population - all other races with this ability only generate ½ magic power per population. Dark Elf Warlocks can cast the Doom Bolt spell and so are much more powerful than other races' Magicians.
race.raceDisadvantages: Dark Elf populations grow very slowly. Dark Elf units are considerably more expensive to build compared to other races. Their magical ranged attack while nice is only strength 1 so in reality has very limited usefulness.
Draconian populations grow slowly. Draconian units are considerably more expensive to build compared to other races.

race.raceAdvantages: Dwarves receive double bonuses from all mineral mines - triple if they build a Miners' Guild. Dwarven workers produce 3 production each instead of the usual 2. Dwarves can build Hammerhands and Steam Cannons, which are both powerful units.
race.raceDisadvantages: Dwarven populations grow very slowly. Dwarven units are considerably more expensive to build compared to other races. Dwarven cities are quite limited in the buildings they are able to build.

race.raceAdvantages: All Troll units Regenerate except for War Mammoths.
race.raceDisadvantages: Troll populations grow very slowly. Troll units are the most expensive of all races to build. Troll units only have 4 figures instead of the usual 6, and so do less damage and have fewer hit points. Trolls cannot build Sages' Guilds, so research is severly limited. Also this means they cannot build Alchemists' Guilds and so cannot use Mithril or Adamantium weapons, and can only use magical weapons by having the Alchemy retort.

building.buildingHelpText: This special setting produces trade goods and converts 2 production to 1 gold.
This special setting builds new housing for the local populace to draw them into the city and increase the city's population growth rate.
Without a barracks, a city cannot organize and train regular military units.
An armoury provides the city with a central location for the distribution and storage of arms and armour.
A fighters' guild teaches troops basic fighting techniques. All new troops start as regulars.
An armourers' guild provides troops with training in fighting techniques and basic battle tactics.
A war college teaches advanced battle strategy and tactics. All new troops start as veterans.
A smithy can develop and produce quality weaponry.
A stable provides training, housing and care of mounted troops and/or war beasts.
Increases each farmer's food harvest by 1, reduces unrest by 1, allows use of nightshade, doubles the healing rate of units inside the city.
A city's fantastic stable houses and cares for magical beasts.
A ship wrights' guild brings together skilled craftsmen to build small boats.
A shipyard provides a city with the necessary equipment and workers to produce medium-sized ships.
A maritime guild produces large ships by training, organizing, and supporting experienced ship builders.
A sawmill will turn wood into deadly weaponry. It increases the production of forest squares by 25%.
A library acts as a storehouse for knowledge and scholarship. It adds +2 spell research points.
A sages' guild is dedicated to the advanced study of magic. It adds +3 spell research points and allows use of nightshade.
An Oracle provides a city with magical guidance, detecting all enemies within 4 squares of the city and reducing unrest by 2.
The alchemists' guild equips all new troops with magic weapons with +1 to hit bonus and the ability to hurt units with Weapon Immunity. It also generates +3 mana.
A university serves as a stronghold for education and scholarship. It adds +5 spell research points.
A wizards' guild acts as a center for the advancement of magic. It adds +8 spell research points at an upkeep cost of 3 mana points a turn.
A shrine provides spiritual comfort to the citizenry. It adds +1 mana, allows use of nightshade, and reduces the unrest level by 1.
A temple serves as a center for basic religious instruction. It adds +2 mana, allows use of nightshade, and reduces the unrest level by 1.
A parthenon provides the city with a central focus for the study and teaching of religion. It adds +3 mana and reduces the unrest by 1.
A cathedral provides the city with a major cultural and religious center. It adds +4 mana and reduces the unrest level by 1.
A marketplace promotes the city's economic growth by increasing the taxable revenues of the city by +50%.
A bank increases the taxable revenues of a city by 50%, in addition to any gains from a marketplace.
A merchants' guild increases the taxable revenues of a city by +100%, in addition to the gains from the marketplace and bank.
A granary serves as a storehouse for the city's food surplus. It adds +2 food and +20 people per turn.
A farmers' market is a focal point for the buying and selling of food surplus. It adds +3 food and +30 people per turn.
A foresters' guild trains hunters and lumberjacks, increasing the food harvest by +2 and production by +25%.
The builders' hall educates workers in skilled building techniques.
A mechanicians' guild teaches advanced engineering techniques, increasing the production points of a city by +50%.
A miners' guild increases any special mineral bonuses by +50% and production by +50%.
Surrounds the city with a high brick wall that extends the detection of enemy units out to 3 squares and lends protection in combat.
When creatures are summoned by the wizard, they appear here in the summoning circle.
Each wizard resides in his or her own fortress. This serves as a base of operations. If the fortress is lost, the wizard is banished and must cast the Spell of Return.

unitType.unitTypeExperienced: EXPERIENCE_LEVEL_NAME troops have the following enhanced combat factors:
unitType.unitTypeMaxNaturalExperience: Normal troops can only achieve higher experience levels by their wizard having the Warlord retort and/or casting the Crusade spell.
unitType.unitTypeMaxExperience: Normal troops may never achieve a level of experience above Champion.

unitType.unitTypeInexperienced: All heroes begin the game at this level.
unitType.unitTypeExperienced: EXPERIENCE_LEVEL_NAMEs have the following enhanced combat factors:
unitType.unitTypeMaxNaturalExperience: A hero can never rise above Demi-god status.
unitType.unitTypeMaxExperience: A hero can never rise above Demi-god status.

unitType.unitTypeInexperienced: Summoned units do not gain experience so this value will never be used.
unitType.unitTypeExperienced: Summoned units do not gain experience so this value will never be used.
unitType.unitTypeMaxNaturalExperience: Summoned units do not gain experience so this value will never be used.
unitType.unitTypeMaxExperience: Summoned units do not gain experience so this value will never be used.

unitSkill.unitSkillHelpText: Help text for Movement: Flying
Swimming skill doesn't appear as an icon therefore this help text will never appear.
Swimming skill doesn't appear as an icon therefore this help text will never appear.
Flying skill when natural ability (e.g. Draconians) doesn't appear as an icon therefore this help text will never appear.
Teleporting allows a unit to move anywhere on the combat map for a cost of 1 movement point.
Forester allows the unit and any other land units stacked with it to pass through forest at a cost of one movement point per square.
Mountaineer allows the unit and any other land units stacked with it to cross mountains and hills at a cost of one movement point per square.
Plane shift allows the unit to shift back and forth between the planes at will.
Poison immunity makes the unit immune to all forms of poison attacks.
Fire immunity makes units immune to fire attacks.
Stoning immunity makes the unit immune to all forms of stoning.

Weapon immunity makes the unit nearly impervious to attacks from normal units that do not have mithril, adamantium, blessed, or flaming weapons, and increases the unit's defense to 10 against magical attacks. Weapon immunity does not protect against summoned creatures and spells.
Missiles immunity makes the unit immune to all forms of missile attacks.
Illusions immunity negates the illusionary bonus of illusionary attacks and makes the unit impervious to illusion-resistance spells. In addition, the unit can see invisible units.
Cold immunity makes the unit impervious to cold attacks.
Magic immunity makes a unit immune to all magic spells and their effects, breath and gaze attacks. Unit's defense (shields) is raised to 50 against all magic ranged and melee attacks.
Large shields add +2 to the unit's defense against all ranged attacks, including magical ranged attacks, thrown weapons and breath attacks.
Wall crusher allows the unit to destroy a section of a stone wall 50% of the time.
Healers will heal 25% of the damage that all units stacked with the healer have sustained after a combat.
Create outpost is reserved for settlers and allows them to build an outpost. The settler unit becomes the start of the new city, so the settler unit is removed.
Invisibility makes the unit susceptible only to ranged attacks when adjacent to an enemy, and otherwise reduces the attacker's chance to hit by 1.
Create undead allows the unit to create new undead of the same type from any units that it has eliminated in combat. This cannot be used on heroes.
Pathfinding allows the unit and other land units stacked with it to move across any land square at the cost of ½ movement point, as if they were on a road.
Non-corporeal allows the unit to pass through any land square at a cost of ½ movement point, and allows it to move through walls unimpeded.
Wind walking allows the unit and all stacked with it to fly.

Regeneration allows the unit to heal one hit per combat phase, and be completely healed at the end of a combat. If the unit was destroyed but its side was victorious, the unit will come back to life, completely healed.
Purify allows a unit to clean corruption from a square.
Stoning gaze makes all enemy figures resist or be stoned before engaging in hand-to-hand combat. Gaze attacks come after breath and thrown attacks.
Stoning touch makes one enemy unit resist or be turned to stone in addition to any other hand-to-hand attack.
Armour piercing halves the effectiveness of the defender's defense rating.
First strike allows the unit to deal its damage before hand-to- hand attacks, but after breath, thrown, and gaze attacks.
Poison attacks force the attacked unit to resist for each level of the poison or suffer one hit for each failure.

Life stealing attacks have an additional resistance check, usually with a penalty. For each point the resistance is failed, the defending unit loses one hit, while the attacker gains one. Units killed mainly by life steal return as undead under the control of their destroyer.
Immolation strikes all enemy units engaged in hand-to-hand with a fire attack of strength 4.
Resistance to Others increases the resistance of all friendly units in the combat by the listed bonus level. The bonus is not cumulative with other creatures with the same ability.
Holy bonus increases the attack strength, defense, and resistance of all friendly units in the combat by the bonus level of the holy bonus. The bonus is not cumulative.
Illusionary attack allows the attacking unit to ignore the defender's armour entirely.
Road Building allows units to build roads.
Scouting increases the range a unit can see on the overland map by the scouting level.
Meld with nodes allows spirits to merge with a magical node and begin channeling the power of the node to you. The process of melding destroys the spirit.
Negate first strike allows the unit to nullify the first strike ability of attackers. This special ability has no effect on thrown, breath, or gaze attacks.
Death immunity negates all spells which cause death and fear.

unitSkill.unitSkillDescription: Caster MANA_REMAINING out of MANA_TOTAL mana remaining
unitSkill.unitSkillHelpText: Caster allows the unit to cast spells like a wizard in combat, without cost of mana points drawn from the wizard's mana reserve. Furthermore, heroes with caster ability add half the caster's skill to a wizard casting overland spells if the hero is inside the wizard's fortress. You must still provide the required mana to support the skill.
EXPERIENCE_ATTRIBUTE_BONUSES This unit currently has SKILL_VALUE_US098 experience, enough to reach EXPERIENCE_NATURAL_LEVEL_NAME levelEXPERIENCE_LEVEL_BOOST. EXPERIENCE_NEXT_LEVEL.
Undead creatures never heal normally or magically and gain all the immunities and vulnerabilities of Death creatures. In addition Undead summoned creatures have a 50% higher maintenance cost.
Luck adds +1 to all of the unit's rolls, including attack, defense, and resistance.
Long range limits range penalties for missile attacks to a maximum of -1.
Thrown weapons allows an attacking unit to hurl its thrown weapons before engaging in hand-to-hand.
Each individual enemy unit engaging the fearful in melee must resist magic or stand frozen in terror, unable to attack, even if swung upon.

Calls upon the forces of light to envelop a target chaos or death creature (unit) with holy fires. A unit unable to withstand (at a penalty of 4 to resistance) the bright, holy flames is instantly destroyed. Units that are undead (black channeled or animated) are particularly susceptible to this spell, having to resist its effects at a penalty of 10.
Doom gaze is a gaze attack that automatically does damage, with no to-hit or defense rolls.
Death gaze makes all enemy units resist or die instantly. The gaze takes effect before actual melee is entered.

unitSkill.unitSkillDescription: AMMO_REMAINING out of AMMO_TOTAL RAT_NAME remaining
unitSkill.unitSkillHelpText: This skill indicates the number of ranged attacks a unit can make during combat.
Lightning breath allows an attacking unit to breathe an armour piercing blast of lightning before entering hand-to-hand.
Fire breath allows an attacking unit to breathe a fiery blast before engaging in hand-to-hand.

Summon demons allows the unit to summon demons in combat. Instead of attacking, the summoner may conjure one demon into combat. The demon always appears where the wizard's units began. The summoned demon will remain even after the summoning creature is slain, but the demon will disappear after combat.
The unit has the ability to merge with the earth, pass through it, and reform itself at its destination.
Increases the defense of the unit by +1 per level of experience. Super Agility increases this bonus by +50%.
Arcane power increases the hero's magical ranged attack by +1 per level of experience. Super Arcane power increases this bonus by 50%.
Armsmaster adds 2 experience to all units stacked with the hero at the end of each turn, per level of experience. Super Armsmaster increases this bonus by 50%.
Blademaster increases the hero's chance to hit by +1 per 2 levels of experience. Super Blademaster increases this bonus by 50%.

unitSkill.unitSkillDescription: Caster MANA_REMAINING out of MANA_TOTAL mana remaining
unitSkill.unitSkillHelpText: Caster allows the unit to cast spells like a wizard in combat, without cost of mana points drawn from the wizard's mana reserve. Furthermore, heroes with caster ability add half the caster's skill to a wizard casting overland spells if the hero is inside the wizard's fortress. You must still provide the required mana to support the skill.
Charmed heroes never fail a resistance roll.
Constitution increases the hero's hits beyond human norms, adding the +1/level to the hero's defense. Super Constitution increases this bonus by 50%.
Leadership increases the attack strength of all units in combat by one per 2 levels of the hero. Super Leadership increases this bonus by 50%.

Legendary represents the hero's reputation and increases the frequency and strength of mercenaries approaching the wizard for hire, as well as decreases the initial hiring cost. The hero adds +3 fame per level of the hero directly to the controlling wizard's fame total. Super Legendary increases this bonus by 50%.
Luck adds +1 to all of the hero's rolls, including attack, defense, and resistance.
Might increases the hero's hand-to-hand attack by +1 per level of experience. Super Might increases this bonus by 50%.
Noble heroes do not cost money but instead contribute 10 gold to your cause each turn.
Prayermaster adds +1/level of experience to all resistance rolls for all units in the battle. Super Prayermaster increases this bonus by 50%.
Sage heroes contribute 3 spell research points per level of experience each turn to the controlling wizards research total. Super Sage ability increases this bonus by 50%.
Instills in target unit an increased resistance (+3) to the elemental magics of chaos and nature. In addition, the unit gains improved defenses to normal magic ranged attacks (+3 to ranged defense).
Adds +1 to each figure's melee attack strength.
Causes the unit's skin to harden, increasing the unit's defense (shields) by one.
Endows the unit with the ability to walk on water. The unit's movement speed remains unchanged.
Endows the target unit (and any other land units units currently stacked with it) with the ability to travel over all land terrain as if it were traveling on roads (at ½ movement point per square).
Improves a unit's defenses (shields) and resistance to Chaos and Nature magic (crosses), by 10 each. These bonuses do not exert cumulative effects with the spell resist elements.
Fuses iron with the unit's skin, making it able to withstand most attacks (adds 5 to defense).

Endows the target unit with the ability to regenerate during combat (by 1 hit point/ turn) and afterwards (by an immediate return to full health at the end of combat). If the creature dies in combat it returns from the dead in a state of full health, if its side won the battle. Note that this spell is not able to return a creature that has been banished or unsummoned (banish, death wish, holy word, unsummon).
Endows the unit with a tremendously improved resistance (+3 crosses) to negative spells from all magic realms!
Surrounds the unit with a magically protective wall of air, making the unit almost totally immune to arrow and sling attacks.

As long as the Spell Lock is in effect, no friendly enchantment on the unit may be dispelled. This also protects fantastic units from the effects of Dispel Evil, Banish, etc. The Spell Lock resists being dispelled as if it had a strength of 150.
Bestows the power of flight upon the unit.

Renders the unit invisible to all units, except those immune to illusion and those that have True Sight. In combat, the unit becomes visible when adjacent to an enemy unit, but still penalizes the to-hit roll of enemy units by -2.
Allows the enchanted unit and all units in its stack to fly on the overland map. Does not work in combat.
Unit is completely immune to all magic spells and their effects, breath and gaze attacks. Unit's defense (shields) is raised to 50 against all magic ranged and melee attacks.
Doubles the unit's movement and number of attacks in combat.

Ranged and melee attacks are harder to defend against (an opponent's ability to defend decreases by one; i.e., each shield loses 10% in its ability to block a hit) and can effectively hit creatures that have Weapon Immunity. Eldritch weapon exerts cumulative effects with flame blade.
Adds demon-skin armour (+2 defense).
Adds a 2 strength fiery breath.
Adds demon wings (2 speed flight).
Adds +2 attack strengths to both melee and missile attacks. Flaming weapons can hit creatures with Weapon Immunity and exert cumulative effects with eldritch weapon.

Surrounds a target unit with a fiery aura that inflicts a strength 4 magic attack on all enemies engaged in melee combat with the target unit. This magic attack is in addition to the unit's normal attacks.
Adds +3 to the unit's defense and resistance against all death or chaos related spells or monster attacks.
Fills the unit with a holy purpose and increases the unit's movement speed by 1.
Blesses the unit's weapons, allowing them to hit creatures which are immune to non-magical attacks and giving a +1 to-hit bonus in combat.
The units' defense is increased by +3.
The unit becomes elite. This spell will automatically be dispelled when the unit becomes elite naturally.
The unit does not suffer from the ignores-armour effect of illusionary attacks, always makes resistance rolls for Sorcery spells, and can see invisible units and through Walls of Darkness.
Allows the unit to shift planes at will, back and forth. While the unit is active and the plane is changed, the unit will move back and forth between planes.
Adds +3 to the unit's attack strength, hits, and resistance.
The unit is resistant to damage from non-magical attacks, and the first two hits sustained by the unit from any attack are ignored.
Protected unit gains almost total immunity from death and chaos magic.
Any time that enemy units attempt to engage in melee combat with the cloaked unit they must first try to overcome their fright (on a per figure basis) before they can attack or counterattack.
Creature becomes a vile undead being with +2 melee attack strength (swords), +1 to missile attack strength (bows), breath attacks, hit points (hearts), resistance (crosses) and defense (shields).
Unit fights (melee) with twice normal strength (swords) while disregarding its own safety (defense of zero, regardless of other defense modifiers).
Unit gains weapon immunity and an insubstantial wraith-like form (the unit is non-corporeal). In addition, the unit may move on the overland map as if every land square was a road.

At the beginning of each turn, the effects of this spell will be determined randomly from this list: 1) unit stands confused, 2) unit moves randomly, 3) unit is controlled by opponent, and 4) no effect (unit is controlled by owner).
If the unit fails to resist, it loses -2 from its chance to hit and loses -1 from its defence (shields).

All creatures within the unit lose -5 to their attacks, defense, and resistance rolls. Mind storm is automatic and does not allow a resistance roll. The spell does not work against units immune to illusions.

Attempts to shatter all the weapons in a normal target unit. The unit gets one chance to resist these powers of chaos; if it is unsuccessful all of the unit's melee, thrown, and missile attack strengths decrease to one.
Reduces the attack strength of the unit by half. [Assume this includes melee, ranged and thrown attacks. What about breath attacks? Doom Gaze? Poison? etc etc]
Reduces the defence strength of the unit by half.
Reduces the magical resistance of the unit to zero.
Saps the strength out of a target unit's creatures, who suffer a penalty of 2 to their melee, thrown and ranged attack strengths. Units get no chance to resist.

Affected unit sleeps through the remainder of combat, providing a defenseless target for enemies. If attacked by an enemy unit while in this condition, a sleeping unit takes the full force of the attack in damage (i.e. its shields are reduced to zero).

unitAttribute.unitAttributeHelpText:
Each icon represents one chance that each figure has to strike a blow in a hand to hand attack. The base chance that each sword icon will score a hit is 30%, although this can be modified by the attacker's + to Hit attribute.
The unit being attacked can then use its Defence attribute to try to block some of the hits. The base chance that each shield icon will block a hit is 30%, although this can be modified by the defender's + to Block attribute.
Melee weapons are available in a number of weapon grades which confer improved stats: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE(UA01+0) Standard weapon IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE(UA01+1) Magic weapon IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE(UA01+2) Mithril weapon IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE(UA01+3) Adamantium weapon
The background colour of each icon depicts the source of the attribute: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_NORMAL Basic statistic of the unit IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_WEAPON_GRADE Bonus from an improved weapon grade IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_EXPERIENCE Bonus from experience IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_HERO_SKILLS Bonus from Might hero skill IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_CAE Bonus from a combat area effect (e.g. node aura or Prayer spell)
A darkened icon represents a minus, for example from a curse type spell.

Each icon represents one chance that each figure has to strike a blow in a ranged attack. The base chance that each ranged icon will score a hit is 30%, although this can be modified by the attacker's + to Hit attribute and, for standard ranged weapons, distance from the target.
The unit being attacked can then use its Defence attribute to try to block some of the hits. The base chance that each shield icon will block a hit is 30%, although this can be modified by the defender's + to Block attribute.
Standard ranged weapons are available in a number of types, and weapon grades which confer improved stats: IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT14+0) IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT0A+0) Standard weapon IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT14+1) IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT0A+1) Magic weapon IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT14+2) IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT0A+2) Mithril weapon IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT14+3) IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT0A+3) Adamantium weapon
Magical ranged attacks are always treated as a particular realm of magic, which is important for spells like Resist Elements and Bless which give defensive bonuses only against specific realms of magic: IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT1F) Chaos magic ranged attack IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT20) Sorcery magic ranged attack IMAGE_RANGED_ATTACK_TYPE(RAT26) Nature magic ranged attack
The background colour of each icon depicts the source of the attribute: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_NORMAL Basic statistic of the unit IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_WEAPON_GRADE Bonus from an improved weapon grade IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_EXPERIENCE Bonus from experience IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_HERO_SKILLS Bonus from Arcane Power hero skill IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_CAE Bonus from a combat area effect (e.g. node aura or Prayer spell)
A darkened icon represents a minus, for example from a curse type spell.

Each icon represents a 10% improvement to the chance each figure has to strike a blow with a melee or ranged attack. The base chance to hit, if a unit has no + to Hit icons, is 30%.
Standard ranged weapons (bows, slings and rocks) also suffer To Hit penalties the further they are from the target. Magical ranged attacks do not suffer distance penalties.
The background colour of each icon depicts the source of the attribute: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_NORMAL Basic statistic of the unit IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_EXPERIENCE Bonus from experience IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_HERO_SKILLS Bonus from Blademaster hero skill IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_CAE Bonus from a combat area effect (e.g. node aura or Prayer spell)
A darkened icon represents a minus, for example from a curse type spell.

Each icon represents one chance that each figure has to block a melee or ranged attack. The base chance that each shield icon will block a hit is 30%, although this can be modified by the unit's + to Block attribute.
When a unit is hit, the first figure will try to block some of the damage using the unit's Defence and + to Block attributes. Any remaining damage is then taken from Hit Points. If the first figure dies and there is still unassigned damage, the second figure will then try to block using the unit's Defence and + to Block attributes before it takes damage and so on. Thus the Defence value is per figure, but every figure does not get to try to block attacks before the first figure takes damage.
Shields are available in a number of weapon grades which confer improved stats: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE(UA04+0) Standard shield IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE(UA04+1) Magic shield IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE(UA04+2) Mithril shield IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE(UA04+3) Adamantium shield
The background colour of each icon depicts the source of the attribute: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_NORMAL Basic statistic of the unit IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_WEAPON_GRADE Bonus from an improved weapon grade IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_EXPERIENCE Bonus from experience IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_HERO_SKILLS Bonus from Agility hero skill IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_CAE Bonus from a combat area effect (e.g. node aura or Prayer spell)
A darkened icon represents a minus, for example from a curse type spell.

Each icon represents a 10% chance to resist a negative spell effect. A resistance value of 10 does not make the unit immune to magic, since many spells give a penalty to resistance or cannot be resisted at all.
The background colour of each icon depicts the source of the attribute: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_NORMAL Basic statistic of the unit IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_EXPERIENCE Bonus from experience IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_CAE Bonus from a combat area effect (e.g. node aura or Prayer spell)
A darkened icon represents a minus, for example from a curse type spell.

Each icon represents one hit point, or health, that each figure in the unit has, or the amount of damage that figure can take.
The background colour of each icon depicts the source of the attribute: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_NORMAL Basic statistic of the unit IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_EXPERIENCE Bonus from experience IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_HERO_SKILLS Bonus from Constitution hero skill IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_CAE Bonus from a combat area effect (e.g. node aura or Prayer spell)
A darkened icon represents damage already taken to the first figure in the unit. The other figures still alive in the unit will be at full health.
For example a unit with 6 figures with 3 hit points each can take a total of 18 hits. If it is only showing a single Heart icon, but still showing all 6 figures, then the unit still has 16 hit points left.

Each icon represents a 10% improvement to the chance each figure has to block an attack. The base chance to defend is 30% and there are very few situations in the game which modify this.
The background colour of each icon depicts the source of the attribute: IMAGE_UNIT_ATTRIBUTE_BACKGROUND_CAE Bonus from High Prayer spell

combatAreaEffect.combatAreaEffectHelpText: The power of the node will attempt to prevent any non-Chaos spells from being cast.
Being under the influence of a Chaos node adds +2 attack, +2 defense and +2 resistance to all Chaos creatures, including Chaos Channeled normal units.
The power of the node will attempt to prevent any non-Nature spells from being cast.
Being under the influence of a Nature node adds +2 attack, +2 defense and +2 resistance to all Nature creatures.
The power of the node will attempt to prevent any non-Sorcery spells from being cast.
Being under the influence of a Sorcery node adds +2 attack, +2 defense and +2 resistance to all Sorcery creatures.

Calls down a powerful electrical storm from which deadly lightning bolts issue.
Three to 5 lightning bolts of strength 8 strike random opponents at the beginning of every turn until the end of combat.

Creates a standing dispel magic spell over the entire battlefield.
A spell cast by the enemy wizard or an enemy hero must first overcome the effects of this dispel magic spell (of strength equal to the magic power poured into the counter magic spell) before it can exert its effects.
Every spell cast by the enemy drains the magic power (strength) of the counter magic spell by 5 mana points and, therefore, lessens its effectiveness against subsequent spells.
Blurs the outline all friendly units making them more difficult to hit. There is a 10% chance that each point of damage done will miss.
All friendly units on the battlefield are rendered invisible.

Flaming melee and missile weapons have a +1 attack strength and can inflict damage on units with Weapon Immunity.
Metal fires and flame blade do not exert cumulative effects.
Distorts ALL (both friendly and enemy) non-chaos units' perception of reality. Affected units suffer a penalty to hit of two (20%).
Endows ALL creatures of chaos with destructive power increasing their melee (swords), missile, magic and Fiery Breath attack strengths by two.

All creatures of life are bathed in the light's glow and gain one to their attack strengths (swords), defense (shield), and resistance (cross).
Creatures of death are hampered by the brightness, losing one to each of their attack strengths, defense, and resistance.
True Light and Darkness exert opposite effects and therefore cancel each other's effects.
Adds +1 to all rolls by all friendly units, including resistance rolls, attacks to hit and defense rolls.

Units with High Prayer have their attack strength (swords), ability to hit, and defense (shields) all increased by 2, while resistance (crosses) is increased by 3 and the ability to block an attack and to hit is increased by 10%.

Calls upon the heavens to bless all friendly normal units' weapons, giving them +1 (i.e., +10%) to hit and the ability to hit creatures with Weapon Immunity.
This effect is not cumulative with holy weapon.
Inspires all of a wizard's normal units so that their levels all raise by one (recruit become regulars, regulars become veterans, etc.).
Adds 25% of total hit points (with a minimum of one hit point added) to the hit points of each of a wizard's creatures.

During every combat turn, each enemy unit must attempt (+1 bonus to resistance) to overcome the terror that grips it, or cower in fear. When a unit is cowering it cannot attack; however, the unit can still counterattack when it is defending against melee attacks initiated by the enemy.

Creatures of death gain one point each in attack strength (swords), defense (shields) and resistance (crosses).
Creatures of life, on the other hand, are dispirited and lose one point each in attack strength, defense and resistance.
True Light and Darkness exert opposite effects and therefore cancel each other's effects.

All enemy spell casters are drained 5 mana each combat turn. This includes the opponent wizard you are currently battling.
Additionally, all units with magical ranged attacks lose one spell shot each turn.
Curses all enemy units, weakening their attack strength (swords) and defense (shields) by one. Their resistance to magic (crosses) is decreased by two.

Wracks all non-death creatures with the agonies of darkness every combat turn.
All enemy figures that cannot resist this pain lose one hit point.

Causes all normal units that die in any combat to become, after the battle ends, mindless zombies under the control of the casting wizard.
These zombies do not heal in any way, nor can they be raised from the dead.

Causes an impenetrable mantle of blackness to smother all the lands in the worlds.
This thick cloak of blackness has the same effect as Darkness cast on every map square.
Only map squares protected by Heavenly Light are unaffected.

spellBookSection.spellTargetPrompt: Select an empty location as the target for your SPELL_NAME spell.
Select a friendly city as the target for your SPELL_NAME spell.
Select a friendly unit as the target for your SPELL_NAME spell.
Select an enemy city as the target for your SPELL_NAME spell.
Select an enemy unit as the target for your SPELL_NAME spell.

spell.spellDescription: Turns a 5x5 area into thick sticky mud for the duration of a battle.
spell.spellHelpText:
Turns a 5 x 5 area into thick, sticking mud for the duration of a battle.
Mud costs a unit (enemy or friendly) all its movement points to enter.
Flying and non-corporeal units are unaffected.

spell.spellDescription: Gives increased resistance and defense to the elemental magics of Chaos and Nature.
spell.spellHelpText: Gives a target unit increased resistance (+3) to the elemental magics of chaos and nature, and improved defense against normal magic ranged attacks (+3 to ranged defense).

spell.spellDescription: Surrounds a target city with a sturdy wall of stone.
spell.spellHelpText: Surrounds a target city with a sturdy stone wall.

spell.spellDescription: Increases target unit's melee attack strength by 1.
spell.spellHelpText: Makes a target unit's creatures stronger (adds +1 to each figure's melee attack strength).

spell.spellDescription: Target unit is immobilized until web is destroyed and prevents flight for the rest of the battle.
spell.spellHelpText:
Casts a sticky, 12 hit point web over a target unit.
Creatures cannot move until they destroy the web with melee and magic ranged attacks.
Web remnants prevent flying units from flying for the rest of the battle.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a group of ferocious bears.
spell.spellHelpText: Summons a group of ferocious bears.

spell.spellDescription: Causes the target's skin to harden increasing the unit's defense by 1.
spell.spellHelpText: Causes a target unit's skin to harden, increasing the unit's defense (shields) by one.

spell.spellDescription: Endows a unit with the ability to walk on water.
spell.spellHelpText:
Endows a unit with the ability to walk on water.
The unit's movement speed remains unchanged.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a group of small, flying forest creatures.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a group of sprites.
Sprites are small, flying forest creatures that can hurl tiny magic attacks over long distances.

spell.spellDescription: Fully reveals terrain, terrain specials, and cities on all squares in a targeted 'map window.'
spell.spellHelpText: Fully reveals terrain, terrain specials, cities and armies on all squares in a targeted 'map window.'

spell.spellDescription: Destroys targeted wall and any unit in the square has a chance to fall in and be destroyed.
spell.spellHelpText:
Tears open a crack in the earth.
Any non-flying, corporeal creature standing over the newly created fissure has a 25% chance (regardless of defense) of falling in and dying.
Stone walls that cross the fissure are destroyed.

spell.spellDescription: Extends the scouting range of a friendly city to 4 squares in all directions.
spell.spellHelpText: Extends the scouting range of a friendly target city to 4 squares in any direction, revealing all lands and all non-invisible enemy troops within that radius.

spell.spellDescription: A 5 strength magical cold attack, +1 damage for each extra point of mana spent.
spell.spellHelpText: Showers a target unit with shards of ice (strength 5 magic cold attack, with every extra point of magic power spent adding a strength of 1 to the attack).

spell.spellDescription: Summons two giant, poisonous, web-casting spiders.
spell.spellHelpText: Summons two giant, poisonous, web-casting spiders.

spell.spellDescription: Changes most terrain to grasslands and grasslands to forests.
spell.spellHelpText:
Alters a target map square, changing deserts, forests, hills and swamps to grasslands; grasslands to forests; volcanoes to mountains; and mountains to hills.
Terrain not listed is not a valid target.

spell.spellDescription: Gives a non-flying unit the ability to cross any land terrain at a cost of ½ movement point.
spell.spellHelpText: Endows a target unit (and any other land units stacked with it) with the ability to travel over all land terrain as if it were traveling over roads (at ½ movement point per square).

spell.spellDescription: Summons a group of flying cockatrices whose slightest touch can turn a creature to stone.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a group of cockatrices.
The deceptively soft, feathered touch of the cockatrice is capable of turning even the hardiest creatures to stone.

spell.spellDescription: Interchages minerals as follows: coal <--> gems, iron <--> gold and silver <--> mithril.
spell.spellHelpText: Interchages minerals as follows: coal <--> gems, iron <--> gold and silver <--> mithril.

spell.spellDescription: Completely heals all units that are stacked in a target land square.
spell.spellHelpText: Completely heals all units (except for creatures of death) that are stacked in a target land square.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a giant basilisk. Basilisk can turn their enemies to stone with a glance.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a giant basilisk.
Basilisks are so frightening to behold that they can turn their enemies to stone simply by gazing in their direction.

spell.spellDescription: Gives greatly increased resistance and defense to the elemental magics of Chaos and Nature.
spell.spellHelpText:
Improves a target unit's defenses (shields) and resistance to Chaos and Nature magic (crosses), by 10 each.
These bonuses do not exert cumulative effects with the spell resist elements.

spell.spellDescription: Attempts to turn an entire enemy unit into stone.
spell.spellHelpText: Attempts to turn an entire enemy unit into stone.

spell.spellDescription: Summons an enormous wall-crushing stone giant.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons an enormous, wall-crushing stone giant.
The massive stone giant is impervious to stoning attacks and can hurl huge boulders at its enemies.

spell.spellDescription: Fuses iron with a target unit's skin, making it able to withstand most attacks.
spell.spellHelpText: Fuses iron with a target unit's skin, making it able to withstand most attacks (adds 5 to defense).

spell.spellDescription: Causes an icy hail storm to attack all figures in a target square with a 6 strength attack.
spell.spellHelpText:
Causes the skies above a target map square to rain down a torrent of icy hail.
All figures occupying that area are struck with a strength 6 magic cold attack.

spell.spellDescription: Causes considerable damage to a city and the units that garrison it.
spell.spellHelpText:
Causes a violent earthquake to shake a target city.
All buildings have a 10% chance of being destroyed.
All non-flying, corporeal creatures have a 15% chance of dying.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a gorgon. Any who see a gorgon can be turned into stone.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a group of gorgons.
These monstrosities, just as their mythological namesakes, are so ugly and frightening to behold that enemies who mistakenly peek in their direction are turned to stone.

spell.spellDescription: Moves a wizard's enchanted fortress to a new city.
spell.spellHelpText: Moves a wizard's enchanted fortress (with summoning circle, if the circle has not previously been moved) to a different city.

spell.spellDescription: Increases a city's food harvest and can convert deserts and corrupted squares into grasslands.
spell.spellHelpText:
A target city's maximum food harvest increases by 50%.
Every turn there is a 10% chance the city's deserts convert to grasslands and volcanoes to verdant hills, and a 20% chance that its corrupted lands return to their pristine state.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a mighty earth elemental in combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons an earth elemental.
The wall-crushing earth elemental disappears when the battle is over.

spell.spellDescription: The target unit will completely regenerate if its side wins in combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Target unit can regenerate during combat (1 hit point/ turn) and afterwards (immediate return to full health).
If the unit dies in combat, it returns in full health as long as its side wins the combat.
The spell cannot return a creature that has been banished or unsummoned.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a fierce behemoth.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a fierce behemoth.
A behemoth is one of the strongest creatures that can be summoned to Arcanus and Myrror.

spell.spellDescription: All enemy units lose 1 movement point each combat turn.
spell.spellHelpText:
Causes all non-flying, corporeal enemy creatures to lose one movement point per turn.
If a creature's movement points are zero, it cannot attack or move the rest of combat; but it can still strike back if attacked.

spell.spellDescription: Reveals the entire map of both planes and detects all units while the spell is in effect
spell.spellHelpText: Reveals all lands, cities and non-invisible creatures on both Arcanus and Myrror!

spell.spellDescription: Several lightning bolts randomly strike enemy units in combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Calls a powerful electrical storm from which deadly lightning bolts issue.
Three to five lightning bolts of strength 8 strike random enemy units at the beginning of every turn until the end of combat.

spell.spellDescription: Summons an awe-inspiring colossus.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons an awe-inspiring colossus.
A colossus is a rock-wielding fighting machine immune to all known forms of poison and petrification.

spell.spellDescription: Units in a city with an earth gate can instantly travel to any other city with an earth gate.
spell.spellHelpText:
Creates a teleporting device within a target city.
Friendly units can teleport between any two of the casting wizard's cities equipped with earth gates, for the cost of one movement point.

spell.spellDescription: All of the caster's units are completely healed at the end of each turn.
spell.spellHelpText: Completely heals all of a wizard's damaged units every game turn.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a gigantic, poisonous, tunneling land wyrm.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a gigantic, poisonous, tunneling land wyrm.
For all its bulk a great wyrm, with its ability to tunnel underground, is frighteningly fast on the battlefield.

spell.spellDescription: All cities owned by a wizard that casts Chaos or Death magic are hit with a minor earthquake.
spell.spellHelpText:
For every non-combat death or chaos spell cast, all the casting wizard's cities suffer tremors.
Each non-flying, corporeal unit has a 10% chance of dying and each building a 5% chance of collapsing.

spell.spellDescription: Adds 3 to all resistance rolls versus magic.
spell.spellHelpText: Adds 3 to all resistance rolls versus magic.

spell.spellDescription: A triple strength version of the arcane spell Dispel Magic.
spell.spellHelpText:
A stronger version of the arcane Dispel Magic.
Every point of mana spent on casting this spell counts as three for the purposes of dispelling the target unit's enchantments.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a floating island in any water square.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons an apparently solid cloud to any visible ocean map square of a wizard's choice.
This thick body of vapors can carry up to eight units across water and moves at a speed of two map squares per turn.

spell.spellDescription: The target unit becomes almost totally immune to arrows and sling bullets.
spell.spellHelpText: Surrounds the unit with a magically protective wall of air, making the unit almost totally immune to arrow and sling attacks.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a group of illusory phantom warriors for the duration of the combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a group of illusory phantom warriors and binds them to the will of the wizard.
The phantoms attack with illusory weapons that completely ignore the target's armour.
When combat ends, the phantom warriors disappear.

spell.spellDescription: Affected units will wander randomly or can even attack their own side.
spell.spellHelpText:
Attempts to confuse a unit so that each turn it randomly does one of the following: stand around and do nothing, move randomly, attack allies, or attack enemies.
A confused unit does not recover (unless disenchanted) until after combat ends.

spell.spellDescription: Transports a friendly unit back to the caster's summoning circle.
spell.spellHelpText:
Transports a target friendly unit back to a wizard's summoning circle.
If there is no space in the city for the recalled unit, one of the units already occupying the city square is displaced to a neighboring land square.

spell.spellDescription: All enemy spell cast in combat must resist being dispelled while this spell is in effect.
spell.spellHelpText:
Creates a reserve of counter magic power which resists all spells cast by an opponent wizard as if you had cast an equally-strong dispel magic.
Each spell casting attempt by the opposing wizard reduces the strength of the counter magic reserve by five mana.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a pair of trident wielding nagas.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a pair of trident-wielding nagas.
These swimming creatures spit poison at their foes during combat.

spell.spellDescription: A 5 strength illusory attack plus 1 strength for every 2 extra mana spent.
spell.spellHelpText:
Targets a unit with an intensely damaging stream of mental energy.
This strength 5 non-physical attack can be increased in strength by one per every two extra mana points spent on the spell.

spell.spellDescription: All friendly units become more difficult to hit. Each point of damage has a 10% chance to miss.
spell.spellHelpText:
Blurs the outline of all friendly units making them more difficult to hit.
There is a 10% chance that each point of damage done to the target unit will miss.

spell.spellDescription: A triple strength version of the arcane spell Disenchant Area.
spell.spellHelpText:
A much stronger version of Disenchant Area, with triple the chance of removing target enchantments.
Each point of mana spent casting the spell counts as three for the purposes of dispelling a target enchantment.

spell.spellDescription: The target unit suffers a -2 penalty to hit and loses 1 defense.
spell.spellHelpText: If a targeted unit fails to resist, it suffers a penalty to hit of 2 (i.e., it has a -20% chance to hit) and has more trouble defending than usual (loses 1 shield).

spell.spellDescription: Prevents a units enchantments from being dispelled.
spell.spellHelpText:
Prevents a target unit's positive enchantments from being dispelled.
If the target unit is a summoned creature, spell lock also protects the bonds that tie it to the controlling wizard.
Spell lock must be dispelled (resistance of 150) before any further enchantments can be removed from the creature or unit.

spell.spellDescription: Enchants all roads in a 5x5 area.
spell.spellHelpText:
Makes all roads within two map squares of the targeted area cost no movement points to travel over for corporeal units, including flying units.
Note that all roads on Myrror are automatically enchanted.

spell.spellDescription: Bestows the power of flight upon a target unit.
spell.spellHelpText:
The target unit gains the ability to fly magically.
The unit's speed is increased to 3 if it was previously less than 3.

spell.spellDescription: Doubles the speed of all ships controlled by a wizard and halves the speed of all others.
spell.spellHelpText: Doubles the speed of all ships and sky masters controlled by a wizard, and halves the speed of all others.

spell.spellDescription: Attempts to destroy an opponent's spell before it has been completely cast.
spell.spellHelpText:
Attempts to counter an enemy wizard's spell as it is being cast.
When spell blast takes effect, a wizard must expend as much of his or her own magic power (from mana reserves) as the enemy wizard has spent on the opposing spell to blast that spell out of existence.
If a wizard does not have enough mana to match his target, spell blast fails.

spell.spellDescription: Improves relations with enemy wizards every turn.
spell.spellHelpText:
Hoodwinks all enemy wizards into liking the casting wizard.
Each turn the spell is in effect, relations are shifted by +1 diplomatic point on a scale of -100 to +100.

spell.spellDescription: Summons an illusory phantom beast for the duration of the combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons an illusory phantom beast.
The phantom beast's attack is illusory, so completely ignore the target's armour.
The phantom beast is immune to all forms of death magic and disappears when combat ends.

spell.spellDescription: A triple strength version of the arcane spell Disjunction.
spell.spellHelpText:
Equivalent to a very strong version of the arcane magic Disjunction, with triple the chance of success.
Each mana spent on casting this spell counts as three for the purposes of dispelling the target global enchantment.

spell.spellDescription: Renders the target unit invisible.
spell.spellHelpText:
Renders the unit invisible to all units, except those Immune to Illusion and those that have True Sight.
In combat, the unit becomes visible when adjacent to an enemy unit, but still penalizes the to hit roll of enemy units by -1.

spell.spellDescription: Enables the enchanted unit and all units with it to fly on the overland map.
spell.spellHelpText:
Allows the enchanted unit and all units in its stack to fly (with a speed of 3) on the overland map.
Has no effect in combat.

spell.spellDescription: Attempts to dispel any summoned creature.
spell.spellHelpText:
Destroys the magical bond that keeps a summoned unit with its controlling magician.
Each figure within the unit must resist at -3 or be returned whence they were summoned.
Every additional 5 mana lowers the targets' resistance by one.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a lightning-bolt wielding storm giant.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a lightning bolt-wielding storm giant.
Storm giants not only hurl vicious lightning bolts over long distances, they also use lightning bolts when fighting hand-to-hand with their enemies.

spell.spellDescription: Summons an invisible air elemental for the duration of the combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons an invisible, flying air elemental during battle.
The creature disappears when combat ends.

spell.spellDescription: Target unit loses 5 strength from all their attacks, defense and resistance.
spell.spellHelpText:
Causes intense mental anguish to the creature(s) in a target enemy unit.
Unable to concentrate, the creatures automatically (with no chance to resist) lose 5 to all of their melee, thrown and ranged attack strengths, defense and resistance.
This spell does not effect units that have Immunity to Illusions.

spell.spellDescription: Locks a stack of enemy units in stasis for a considerable time.
spell.spellHelpText:
Paralyzes all enemy units in a target map square for a minimum of one turn.
After the first turn a unit passes in stasis, it has one opportunity per turn to free itself by successfully resisting (at a penalty of 5 to resistance) the stasis field.

spell.spellDescription: Gives a target unit almost complete immunity to all forms of magic.
spell.spellHelpText:
Makes a target unit completely immune to all magic spells and spell-like effects.
It also gives the unit immunity to breath and gaze attacks.
Finally, the unit is almost completly immune to all magical ranged attacks.

spell.spellDescription: Doubles a unit's movement and number of attacks in combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Doubles the movement (speed) and number of attacks (both melee and ranged) of a target unit.
The target unit becomes so fast that it even counterattacks (when defending during melee combat) twice.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a spell casting djinn.
spell.spellHelpText: Summons a djinn. This powerful, flying being can hurl ranged magic attacks at its opponents and is capable of casting up to 20 spell points of sorcery magic during every combat.

spell.spellDescription: Completely protects a city from one type of magic. May be cast multiple times.
spell.spellHelpText:
Provides total immunity for the city from one specific realm of spells (including combat spells) and prohibits any summoned creatures of that realm from entering the protected city.
Caster must select which realm to ward against: chaos, death, life, nature, or sorcery.

spell.spellDescription: Attempts to take control of an enemy summoned creature in combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Attempts to alter the allegiance of a summoned creature.
If a target creature fails to resist the spell (at a penalty of 2 to its resistance), it is bound to fight for the casting wizard until the end of combat (or until disenchanted).
The bound creature disappears after combat ends.

spell.spellDescription: Renders all friendly units invisible.
spell.spellHelpText:
Makes all friendly units invisible to their opponents.
While invisible, the units cannot be targeted by ranged weapons and all melee attacks against them suffer a penalty to hit of one (i.e., -10% chance to hit).

spell.spellDescription: Attempts to banish all (including your own) summoned creatures from both Arcanus and Myrror.
spell.spellHelpText:
Tries to banish all summoned creatures (including those bound to the casting wizard) from both Arcanus and Myrror!
Creatures suffer a penalty of 2 to their resistance when attempting to oppose this spell.

spell.spellDescription: Attempts to take control of an opponent's global enchantment.
spell.spellHelpText:
Attempts to steal a global enchantment from another wizard.
The stolen global spell becomes the property of the casting wizard in terms of maintenance and control.

spell.spellDescription: Suspends the city containing a wizard's enchanted fortress far above the earth.
spell.spellHelpText:
Suspends the city containing a wizard's enchanted fortress far above the earth.
Only flying units may enter (or attack) and leave this 'city in the clouds.'
The wizard's own foot troops may enter and exit the city overland. During combat, once a foot troop (non-flying unit) leaves the floating city it cannot re-enter until the battle is over.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a powerful wind dragon.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a fierce, lightning-breathing wind dragon from the realm of air.
The powerful sky drake is immune to magic and illusions.
Its lightning breath can easily vaporize most opponents.

spell.spellDescription: All enemy spell cast on the overland map must resist or be dispelled
spell.spellHelpText: All overland spells not cast by caster must overcome a 500 mana strength dispel or be eliminated.

spell.spellDescription: Freezes all enemy wizards and units in time.
spell.spellHelpText:
Freezes all enemy wizards and units in time.
Time itself is not frozen, that is the turn counter (and date) count up as normal.
Enemy wizards' are unable to move units, cast spells overland, or take any other action other than defending in combat against any attacks that the casting wizard initiates.
The casting wizard must pay maintenance on this spell, but only on this spell.

spell.spellDescription: Destroys a unit's missile attack ability.
spell.spellHelpText:
Immediately twists and destroys all missile ammunition of a target normal unit, removing that unit's ability to attack at range.
There is no way to prevent the effect of this spell.

spell.spellDescription: Destroys a section of stone wall.
spell.spellHelpText: Destroys one section of stone wall, clearing a way for troops to pass through.

spell.spellDescription: A 5 strength magical fire attack +1 strength per additional mana.
spell.spellHelpText: Shoots a bolt of intense flames at one figure in a target unit, striking as 5 strength magical fire attack, +1 point of strength per additional mana spent.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a wild pack of fire-breathing hell hounds
spell.spellHelpText: Summons and binds a wild pack of fire-breathing hell hounds to the will of the wizard.

spell.spellDescription: Corrupts a map square so that it will yield no food or minerals.
spell.spellHelpText:
Desecrates the target land square.
Corrupted lands produce no food or minerals, and can only be restored to production by the prayers of clerics or shamans.

spell.spellDescription: Enchant a unit's weapons so that opponent's defense is reduced.
spell.spellHelpText:
Imbues the target unit's weapons with a powerful chaotic spirit.
These weapons are harder to defend against (an opponent's ability to defend decreases by 10%) and can effectively hit creatures with weapon immunity.
Effects are cumulative with Flame Blade.

spell.spellDescription: Units crossing the wall suffer a 4 strength fireball attack.
spell.spellHelpText:
Encircles a city with a protective wall of flames.
Each figure of any non-flying unit that attempts to pass through suffers a 5 strength magical fire attack.
Ranged attacks are not affected.

spell.spellDescription: Target unit's melee, thrown and missile strengths reduced to 1.
spell.spellHelpText:
A target unit receives one resistance roll to ignore Shatter's effects.
If it is unsuccessful, all of the unit's melee, thrown, and missile attack strengths decrease to one.

spell.spellDescription: Target unit receives a harmful mutation.
spell.spellHelpText:
Attempts to mutate all creatures within a target unit.
Mutated or warped creatures suffer one of the following degenerative changes: half strength attacks, half strength defense, or no magic resistance.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a fire elemental for the duration of combat.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a fire elemental to do battle for the wizard.
Fire elementals have weapon immunity and fire immunity.
Once combat ends, the fire elemental returns to the plane of chaos.

spell.spellDescription: A 5 strength armour piercing attack +1 strength per additional mana.
spell.spellHelpText:
Shoots a bolt of intense electricity at the target unit, striking as a strength 5 armour-piercing magical attack.
The strength of the attack can be increased by +1 strength per each additional mana spent.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a fire giant.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a fire giant and binds it to the will of the wizard.
Fire giants have fire immunity and can destroy walls.

spell.spellDescription: Normal unit receives a beneficial mutation and becomes a Chaos creature.
spell.spellHelpText:
Transforms the target into a creature of chaos.
Target unit receives one of following mutations: demon-skin armour (+2 defense), demon wings (2 speed flight), or fire-breathing (2 strength fiery breath).
Once affected by this spell, the creature can never be Chaos Channeled again.
By becoming a creature of chaos, the target unit is then affected by spells as like a summoned Chaos creature, for spells such as Resist Elements, Bless, Warp Reality or Chaos Surge.

spell.spellDescription: Normal unit's weapons enchanted to +2 attack strength.
spell.spellHelpText:
Causes the weapons of a target unit to burst into flames, increasing the strength of melee and missile attacks of the unit by 2.
Flame Blades also allow units to hit creatures which have weapon immunity, and exerts cumulative effects with Eldritch Weapon.

spell.spellDescription: Summons flying gargoyles that are extremely difficult to damage.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a group of flying gargoyles.
Gargoyles are extremely difficult to damage, as one might expect flying chunks of masonry to be, and exhibit immunity to stoning and poison attacks.

spell.spellDescription: A 5 strength magical fire attack that hits each figure of target unit, +1 strength per 3 extra mana
spell.spellHelpText:
Hurls a flying ball of exploding flames at a target unit, striking each figure in the unit with a strength 5 magic fire attack.
The strength of the attack can be increased by +1 for every additional 3 mana spent.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a doom bat that has a fearsome fiery aura.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a doom bat and binds it to the will of the wizard.
The doom bat has a fearsome fiery aura which strikes all units it engages with a 4 strength fireball.

spell.spellDescription: Creates a volcano that produces no food or minerals but provides 1 mana per turn
spell.spellHelpText:
Raises a volcano, destroying any food and minerals provided by a target map square.
The volcano provides 1 magic power each turn to the caster.
If this spell is cast on a city, each building has a 15 % chance of collapsing.
Mountains, hills, and nodes may not be targeted.

spell.spellDescription: Surrounds unit in fiery aura. Units in melee with immolating unit are hit with a 4 strength fireball.
spell.spellHelpText: Surrounds the target unit with a fiery aura that inflicts a strength 4 magical fire attack on all enemies engaging the immolating unit in melee combat.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a horrific flying, fire breathing, three-headed chimera.
spell.spellHelpText: Summons a horrific flying, fire breathing, three-headed chimera.

spell.spellDescription: Hits target unit with multiple lightning bolts starting at 10 strength and decreasing to 1.
spell.spellHelpText:
Sends a chain of lightning bolts ripping through a target unit.
The first bolt of lightning has a strength of 10, the second a strength of 9, and so on until the last bolt delivers a 1 strength attack or the unit is destroyed.

spell.spellDescription: Enchants all normal units in a combat with a reduced strength(+1) Flame Blade.
spell.spellHelpText:
Bestows a reduced strength Flame Blade on all normal units, increasing their melee and missile attack strengths by 1 and allowing them to inflict damage on units with Weapon Immunity.
This spell is not cumulative with Flame Blade.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a fearsome chaos spawn that have multiple gaze attacks.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a chaos spawn and binds it to the will of the wizard.
Chaos spawn cause fear in melee, are poisonous, and have Doom, Death and Stoning Gaze attacks.

spell.spellDescription: Target unit takes 10 points of damage regardless of defense.
spell.spellHelpText: Calls forth the awesome power of chaos to strike the target enemy unit for 10 points of damage, regardless of the unit's defenses.

spell.spellDescription: Summons randomly moving vortex that damages all in its path.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a magic vortex that does 5 hits of damage to any units is passes over, regardless of defense.
In addition, each time the vortex moves, adjacent units may be struck by lightning bolts.
Each combat turn, the vortex moves 3 squares randomly and in 1 direction controlled by the caster.
A magic vortex does terrible damage to a city that it moves through.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a spell casting Efreet.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a fire bolt-throwing, flying efreet and binds it to the will of the wizard.
Efreeti are immune to magical fire and have the ability to cast 20 points of Chaos spells each combat.

spell.spellDescription: All enemy units in map square are hit by an 8 strength fireball.
spell.spellHelpText:
Rains fiery balls of flaming stone down on an entire map square, striking all figures in each unit within the area with a strength 8 magical fire attack.
Even units within cities are affected.

spell.spellDescription: All non-Chaos creatures in this combat have a -2 penalty to hit.
spell.spellHelpText:
Warps the fabric of reality and distorts a unit's senses.
All non-chaos units, enemy or friendly, have a -2 to their chance to hit.

spell.spellDescription: All enemy units in combat are hit by a 15 strength magical fire attack.
spell.spellHelpText: Strikes all enemy units with a 15 strength magical fire attack.

spell.spellDescription: Units in an enemy city are struck by 5 randomly targeted 8 strength lightning bolts each turn
spell.spellHelpText:
Opens a great magical vortex over an enemy city.
Each turn, units inside the city sustain five strength 8 Lightning Bolt attacks, and there is a 5% chance of a building being destroyed.

spell.spellDescription: Summons a 9-Headed fire-breathing, regenerating Hydra.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons a nine-headed hydra.
Each fire-breathing head on this monstrous creature can regenerate during and after combat.

spell.spellDescription: Target unit with a less than 10 resistance is irrevocably destroyed.
spell.spellHelpText:
If the target has a resistance of less than 10, it is instantly and irrevocably destroyed.
There is no method to restore a unit that has been disintegrated.
Units with a resistance of 10 or more are not valid targets.

spell.spellDescription: All units on overland map not in cities are hit with an 4 strength fireball.
spell.spellHelpText:
Rains down fiery hail upon both planes, striking all creatures outside cities with a strength 4 magical fire attack.
Buildings within cities may also be destroyed (1% chance each turn a building is destroyed).
The casting wizard's cities are immune to the effects.

spell.spellDescription: Several map squares are corrupted each turn. The area controlled by the caster's cities is immune.
spell.spellHelpText:
Once this enchantment has been cast, the entire world begins to slowly be corrupted.
Each turn 3-6 map squares are withered as per the spell Corruption.
The caster's cities and surrounding areas are, of course, exempt.

spell.spellDescription: All enemy units in combat are hit with a random effect from being healed to being disintegrated.
spell.spellHelpText:
Strikes every enemy unit with a random effect from the following list: Nothing, Healing, Chaos Channels, Warp Creature, Fire Bolt (15 strength), Warp Lightning, Doom Bolt, or Disintegrate.
Note some of these effects can actually be beneficial to the target unit.

spell.spellDescription: All Chaos creatures receive a +2 bonus to all attack strengths.
spell.spellHelpText: All creatures of chaos have 2 added to their hand-to-hand, missile, fire-breath, and magic attacks

spell.spellDescription: All newly built units are affected by a Chaos Channels spell.
spell.spellHelpText: All newly created normal units controlled by the casting wizard are mutated by the effects of chaos, the same as if Chaos Channels had been cast on them.

spell.spellDescription: Summons the all powerful great drake.
spell.spellHelpText:
Summons an avenging fire-breathing dragon from the depths of chaos.
The flames spewing from a great drake's jaws are so hot that weak opponents may be incinerated before ever getting a chance to fight back.

spell.spellDescription: Does a terrific amount of damages to a city and all the units in it.
spell.spellHelpText:
Every building in the target city has a 50% chance to be destroyed, and each unit inside the city takes 10 points of damage regardless of defense.
The amount of pure chaos being released also corrupts the surrounding area.

spell.spellDescription: Several volcanoes are raised each turn. The area controlled by the caster's cities is immune.
spell.spellHelpText:
Begins to destroy the entire world, as volcano after volcano rises, ravaging the lands of both worlds.
Like Raise Volcano, the casting wizard gains one point of power from each new volcano created.

spell.spellDescription: Gives increased resistance and defense to the evil magics of Chaos and Death.
spell.spellHelpText: Adds 3 to the target unit's defense and resistance against all death or chaos related spells or monster attacks.

spell.spellDescription: A 15 strength attack that is only effective versus Chaos and Death creatures.
spell.spellHelpText:
Causes a holy blaze of burning light from the stars (strength 15 magic attack) to fall upon a target chaos or death unit.
No other creatures can be affected.
